ABONNER_BANNER.BANNER_TEXT_LINE_1: Get alerts from Varsom sent to SMS or e-mail.
ABONNER_BANNER.BANNER_TEXT_LINE_2: Set up or manage your alerts here.
ABONNER_BANNER.TITLE: Varsom Abonner

LEGAL_TERMS.LINE_1: Use the warnings, data and maps at your own risk. Errors and omissions may be present.
LEGAL_TERMS.LINE_2: A warning is a planning tool and may differ from the actual situation. Always make your own evaluation. Conditions may be complex and differ from the warning.
LEGAL_TERMS.LINE_3: Data on Regobs is produced by the users and is available «as is». It may contain errors and omissions. NVE makes no warranties for errors, omissions and assessments produced by the users.
LEGAL_TERMS.TERMS: Data on Varsom Regobs is produced by the users of Regobs and is available as it is. The information may contain errors and omissions. NVE makes no guarantee for the quality or accuracy of the information which is found on Regobs and does not take responsibility for data which is incorrect or misleading. The number of stars besides a username (1-5) indicates the level of competence of the person providing observations. Without stars, competence is unknown or low.

LOGIN.SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE: Error while connecting to the service. Do you have mobile network? Please wait a few minutes and try again.

ABOUT_OBSERVATIONS.MESSAGE:
Use observations at your own risk, produced by the users  and is available «as is».
NVE makes no warranties for errors, omissions and assessments produced by the users.
Consider the observations in light of the competence of the observer, as shown by stars next to the name.

ABOUT_SUPPORT_MAPS.MESSAGE: Use the maps at your own risk and always make your own evaluation. The maps may contain errors and omissions.

SNOW_PROFILE.IS_PROFILE_TO_GROUND: Is the profile dug to the ground?
SNOW_PROFILE.SNOW_PROFILE_HELP_TEXT: Unfortunately, we do not have a form for snow profiles in the current version of the Varsom Regobs app. But, you can upload a picture of a hand drawn profile or an export from a third party app like Ullr Labs Avalanche. On regobs.no you may update the profile information with the forms and plots provided there.

COMPETENCE_PAGE.LINE_1: Use the information in the app, but also make your own judgments. View the observations in context of the observer's competence that appears as stars by the name.

PAGE_1.LINE_1: View observations and warnings when you plan your trip.

PAGE_2.LINE_1: See where you are in relation to danger zones in the terrain. Use support maps adapted to the dangers you are looking for.

PAGE_3.HEADER: Share what you have seen with others!
PAGE_3.LINE_1: Share your observations and photos with others.

PAGE_4.LINE_1: Choose what to see and share on Regobs. You can read about sharing observations at varsom.no/snøskredskolen and varsom.no/isskolen

SUPPORT_MAP.ICE_MAP_DESCRIPTION: The support map shows parts of watercourses that behave unpredictably throughout the winter due to regulations for power generation
SUPPORT_MAP.INFO_PAGE:
About maps with slope angle and runout zones

The maps are automatically produced and may contain errors. There may be steep terrain, which is not represented in the elevation model and thus not displayed in the maps. Some avalanches may have longer runouts that what is displayed as runout zones in the maps.

What consideration to take?

Adjust your risk by choosing where, when and how you travel. Varsom Regobs is a planning tool and its data may differ from the actual situation. Always make your own evaluation.  

When is it safe?

All travel in snow covered avalanche terrain has an element of risk.

Want to learn more?

You may learn more by taking an avalanche safety course and on Snøskredskolen on Varsom.no.
SUPPORT_MAP.STEEPNESS_COLOR_INFO: Colors indicate the slope angle of the terrain
SUPPORT_MAP.STEEPNESS_MAP_DISCLAMER: For trip planning only. The map is automatically produced and may have errors and omissions, e.g. steep terrain not displayed.
SUPPORT_MAP.STEEPNESS_OUTLET_LEGEND_TEXT_1: Short runouts (50% of the avalanches reach farther)
SUPPORT_MAP.STEEPNESS_OUTLET_LEGEND_TEXT_2: Medium runouts (25% of the avalanches reach farther)
SUPPORT_MAP.STEEPNESS_OUTLET_LEGEND_TEXT_3:
Long runouts (5% of the avalanches reach farther)
Some avalanches may have longer runouts that displayed as runout zones in the map.
SUPPORT_MAP.STEEPNESS_OUTLET_MAP_DESCRIPTION: Slope angle shading map with runout zones
SUPPORT_MAP.STEEPNESS_OUTLET_MAP_DISCLAMER:
For trip planning only. The map is automatically produced and may have errors and omissions, e.g. steep terrain or runouts not displayed.

Colours give runout zones for avalanches:

TRIP.COMMENT_DESCRIPTION: Describe what kind of trip you are going and what you are looking for, etc.
TRIP.END_ERROR: Could not stop trip. Please try again later. The trip will stop automatically by midnight.
TRIP.ERROR: Error while starting trip. Please try again.
TRIP.ERROR_POSITION: Cannot start trip without GPS position.
TRIP.LEGACY_HELP_TEXT:
You can use this form to report that you are planning a trip today.

It is useful for the forecaster team to know if observations can be expected today. It is also useful to know what kind of observations can be expected (what are you looking for, where are you going on a trip) and when do you expect these to be submitted to Regobs.

All paid observers must record what types of obs-tour are being planned: is it an ordinary paid observation trip, or is this an additional registration? Additional registration is the submission of observations you have made during other work or in your spare time.
TRIP.TITLE: Trips

WARNING_LIST.B_REGIONS_SUBTITLE: Warnings only for danger level 4 and 5
WARNING_LIST.NO_FAVOURITES_TEXT: Swipe the alert you want to favorite and it will appear here.
WARNING_LIST.NO_WARNINGS_TEXT: There is no warnings for the area you are in. When there is any, they will appear here.
